comment: Hes clearly passionate about the material but the passion does not translate into his ability to lecture. The lectures are one picture for 2 lectures and half of the material he covers in class is just excess and not on tests. His test grading is tough. Looks for any reason to take off points. My advice is to just read the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. He's incredibly caring and really gets to know his students. He keeps class interesting and entertaining and is great at explaining things. This class felt like a small family. Dr. Ensign was very personable and really showed his care for his students. Would definitely recommend! You will have to work hard!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: nice professor but DO NOT TAKE. If you don't LOVE animals then this class is not for you. pointless class, no power point just talk a lot of nonsense. you'll spend time in lab grouping fish and counting dear horns then you'll have to learn 50 bird sound for extra credit and spend a week outside looking for birds. 4 exams including final, drops 1.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I took Dr. Ensign for a required biology seminar and it was perfect. The class is pass/fail so he doesn't waste time making it hard. Show up ON TIME, sign the role, listen to a 45 min presentation from a guest speaker, and you're done. There are 2 mandatory "assessments" so don't miss them or you fail. Only requires attendance to 10 lectures.

Very knowledgeable. However doesnt use any visuals just lectures whole time which can be difficult for some learners especially when comparing anatomies of organisms. Extra credit assignments are available. The textbook was a lifesaver for me when his lectures got confusing. He posts outlines of sections to focus on and study guides for all tests
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Tests are tough

comment: He is a very nice and caring teacher. The lectures and labs were interesting, although a little unorganized. And tests and lab quizes were fair. I would definitely take him again. 4 exams and a umulative final, but you can drop your lowest one. Lab quiz for each lab unit and a final project and paper due at the end.

THERE IS NO TEXTBOOK OR LAB MANUAL FOR THIS COURSE!! All we had to study was our class notes & low-quality D2L downloads. Dr. Ensign rambles during his lectures. He vacated the class halfway through, to go count snails with a Grad student, leaving us with 2 part timers. Note: Labs feature electro-shocking fish to obtain "quick n' easy" samples...

It is clear that Dr. Ensign loves what he does. He is passionate and he is helpful. Testsmult. choice + 3 short essays. Not too bad though. Everything comes from the lecture so make sure you are in class! He provides study questions that help a lot, too. Lab is pretty fun-lots of lab tests but study hard and you'll be fine. Def. recommend!

Fun guy. Tests aren't hard, but some short answer Q's can be. Lab practicals were way too fast for what was expected. Spent too long on fish. Overall lectures were good. No PPT's, notes come from what he says/writes in class. Material can be found in the textbook if you miss a class though & he gives outlines per chpt+study Q's. REALLY loves fish.

Great professor. Really wants his students to think critically about the material. Very possible to do well if you just do the work and take good notes. If you are unclear about something, he will help you, but only if he can tell you've tried on your own. He won't just give you answers, but he'll put you on the right path.

Dr. Ensign is SO COOL! He is incredibly passionate and enthusiastic about his field of work (especially for a 9am class!) The course involves specific details about MANY species, and his lecture notes are primarily verbal. If you know how to read the book and take good notes, you'll do fine in the class, and you'll greatly enjoy Dr. E's enthusiasm!

Vert Zoo is a great class. It's really interesting to learn about vertebrates and the phylogenetic relationship of the major groups. Dr. E is very approachable, passionate about his work and wants his students to do well. The material isn't easy, but the tests cover exactly what is covered in class. I recommend it, but you have to work hard.

He doesn't like the textbook so be prepared to take very random notes in class. The only students who understand his lectures are ones who have had him before. His tests are half essay and he will just grade like an English teacher. (Example -15 points of an essay with no explanation)

Dr. E is so great. Willing to help. His lectures seem laid back, but you have to know pretty detailed stuff. You should use the book. His tests are pretty difficult but if you know the notes extremely well and know concepts, you will be fine. Going to class is crucial. I completely recommend Dr. Ensign, one of the best profs I've had.

he's a nice guy. Doesn't curve grades or offer extra credit, but all of his tests have a super easy give away question at the very end. He also drops your lowest test grade and lets you know what you need to make on your final to raise your grade a letter before you take it. You get to keep old tests to study for the final. Labs are all online.

HORRIBLE! At first he takes forever to explain stuff then halfway through the semester he tries to cram everything in. Notes and lectures are ALL over the place, you never know whats going on! Tests are ridiculous. I haven't opened the book once! I will never take him ever again!

This is the second time I've had Dr. Ensign. People think I'm crazy for taking him twice but I'm in love with this class! Tests are multiple choice and short answer. The tests are hard but if you have good note taking skills you will do great! Dr. Ensign loves this class and it shows. He seems unapproachable but if you go to him he is very helpful.

Dr. Ensign scared me at first but after you learn more about him and the class he is great. Tests are hard and if you are not good with taking notes you are in trouble. He tends to skip around and you have to pay close attention. One thing I love about him is his passion for what he teaches. When he gets excited about the material so do you.

He's a concept guy, not a memorization guy. He grades lab write-ups pretty severely.  But you should know how to structure a lab at this level.  You don't have to have the book, but it helps clarify concepts if you have bad note taking skills.  His tests are short so questions are weighted heavily which may not work in your favor most of the time.

No attendance policy, but it helps a lot if you hear the lectures - does not post notes online anymore.  Book is not really required. No test review. You need to know your stuff in order to do well on his very difficult tests!  No big projects, papers, etc. in this class.

Interesting and extremely challenging.  Attendance is not mandatory, but you'll fail if you skip out a lot.  Tests are straight from lecture, but they're nothing like you've ever had before! No memorizing terms, etc. - you have to know what he's talking about & be able to apply it.  Essays are a doozey! Book  not required.

Best class I ever had.  It narrowed down my Major concentration and really gave me a focus for my studies.  Dr. Ensign is extremely approachable and very willing to help.  He's a hands-on prof, so expect field work.  He's also a fish-guy, so if you hate fish, just keep quiet about it :)
NO ATTENDANCE POLICY....notes online....pretty clear what will be on test....lab section easy and straightforward....
For a lecture/lab, I thought Dr. Ensign made the class very interesting and relevant.  I enjoyed the class so much that I asked to have him as my advisor.
STRUCTURED NOTES. PRETTY GOOD TEACHER

Challenging describes this class, since it does not matter if you memorize the material.  You have to know how to apply it. This makes for some creative tests and quizes but all in all its not a hard class.  You have to do the labs and play his game to succeed.
He is definately not the easiest teacher. He is however extremely helpful if you express knowledge and interest in what you are doing. He makes you "think outside of the box"!!!
If he don't like you don't ask for anything.
